{"chunk": "balance itself out. The accounting department are very diligent on monitoring the movement of exchange rates and the use of
currency hedging strategies, with approval of the board.
Treasury operations and financial instruments
The company's principal financial instruments include financial assets and liabilities such as trade debtors and trade creditors arising
directly from operations.
Liquidity risk
The company manages its cash in order to ensure that at any point the company has sufficient liquid resources to meet the operating", "context": "This chunk discusses the company's treasury operations, financial instruments, and liquidity risk management, as part of the Strategic Report's section on Principal Risks and Uncertainties."}
